document.masterDocTitle: On some Maerid genera (Crustacea, Amphipoda, Maeridae) collected by the Hourglass Cruises (Florida). Part 1: Genera Anamaera, Ceradocus, Clessidra gen. nov., Jerbarnia, Maera, Meximaera, with a key to world Ceradocus

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: On some Maerid genera (Crustacea, Amphipoda, Maeridae) collected by the Hourglass Cruises (Florida). Part 1: Genera Anamaera, Ceradocus, Clessidra gen. nov., Jerbarnia, Maera, Meximaera, with a key to world Ceradocus

bibRefCitation.author: Fox RS
bibRefCitation.refString: Fox RS. 1973. Ceradocus shoemakeri and Eriopisa schoenerae, new amphipods from the Bahama islands. J Elisha Mitchell Sci Soc. 89: 1049 - 1059.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Ceradocus shoemakeri Fox, 1973: 147–152
, figs. 1–4;
LeCroy, 2000: 73
, fig. 121.

caption.paragraph:
Figure 5.
Ceradocus shoemakeri
male 5 mm, FSBC I 45601. A1,2, antenna 1,2; Md, mandible; UL, upper lip; Gn1, gnathopod 1; Gn2, Gn2′, Gn2″, different shapes during allometric growth of gnathopod 2; P4, P7, peraeopod 4, 7; Ep1–3, epimeral plates 1–3; Ep3′, Ep3″ variations in serration of posterior margin of epimeral plate 3; Us 1,2, Us 1,2′, shape of two different urosome segments 1,2; u1,2, uropod 1,2; T, telson.

subSubSection.paragraph: Gn2 sexually dimorphic, in male asymmetrical, palmar margin of enlarged side straight, with two broad subquadrate processes (lacking on other side). Pleon segments posterodorsal margins entire, lacking teeth or serrations. Ep1–3 serrated. Us1,2 posterodorsal margin with single weak median tooth. T lobes subapical robust setae short.
Bahama Islands ( Fox 1973 ); south Florida from Biscayne Bay south to the Dry Tortugas ; Apalachee Bay and Perdido Key, Florida; Caribbean ( LeCroy 2000 ).

Common on coral rubble, algae and sponge bottoms at depths of 0.5–6.0 m; also occasionally found in grassbeds ( LeCroy 2000 ). Here down to
73 m .
